recommendations.name: Seito Masamune Tantanmen Tsujita
recommendations.area: Multiple locations (Ogawamachi, Kojimachi, Ichigaya, and more)
recommendations.description: Key's personal favorite. Authentic Chengdu-style tantanmen by Tsujita (of tsukemen fame) — 18 locations across Japan. Rich sesame broth with customizable spice levels (Key goes level 3). Counter seating at most spots.

recommendations.name: SHIBIRE NOODLES Rousokuya (蝋燭屋)
recommendations.area: Multiple locations (Ginza honten, Omotesando Hills, Kyobashi Edogran)
recommendations.description: Famous mapo tofu noodles (mabo men) — Sichuan peppercorn-heavy, tongue-numbing, deeply addictive. Also serves tantanmen and hot & sour noodles. Expect a line at lunch, especially the Ginza flagship.

recommendations.name: Imakatsu (イマカツ)
recommendations.description: The best chicken katsu in Tokyo. Their sasami katsu (chicken fillet) from Iwate Prefecture contract farm will change how you think about chicken breast — impossibly juicy and tender. Hidden on a small side street near Roppongi station.

recommendations.name: Butagumi (豚組)
recommendations.description: Hallowed tonkatsu spot in a quaint residential house — choose your cut and prefecture's brand-name pork. Michelin Bib Gourmand. One of the best tonkatsu experiences in Tokyo.

recommendations.name: Butagumi Shokudo (豚組食堂)
recommendations.description: Casual sibling of Butagumi — same incredible pork, more accessible setting. The lunch deal (until 3:15pm) is exceptional value. Popular with international diners.

recommendations.name: Sobamae Yamato (蕎麦前 山都)
recommendations.description: Elegant soba spot on the first floor of Roppongi Hills. Handmade buckwheat noodles in a refined open-kitchen setting. Great for a proper soba-mae experience (appetizers + soba).

recommendations.name: Shin Udon (慎)
recommendations.description: World-famous udon brasserie — the viral carbonara udon is a must, but everything here is incredible. Handmade noodles with perfect chew. Featured in Bon Appétit. Expect a line.

recommendations.name: Fuunji (風雲児)
recommendations.description: One of Tokyo's best tsukemen — rich, intense chicken and fish dipping broth with thick noodles. Always a line but it moves fast. Counter seating, vending machine ordering.

recommendations.name: Mugi to Olive (むぎとオリーブ)
recommendations.description: Michelin Bib Gourmand ramen — famous for their Triple Soba made with chicken, dried sardines, and hamaguri clam broth. Refined, light, and deeply flavorful. Behind Ginza Six. Expect a queue at lunch.

recommendations.name: Yakumo (八雲)
recommendations.description: One of Tokyo's best wonton ramen spots. Famous for white (shio) and black (shoyu) dashi wontonmen — delicate, refined broth with plump handmade wontons. Cash only, vending machine ordering. Expect a wait.
